conclusion: To determine acceleration or deceleration, analyze the graph of reciprocal velocity vs. displacement.
The x-axis represents displacement (x) and the y-axis represents the reciprocal of velocity (1/v).
The graph is a straight line with a positive slope.
A positive slope indicates that as x increases, 1/v also increases.
Since 1/v is increasing, v must be decreasing because they are inversely related.
If velocity v is decreasing, the particle is decelerating.
Deceleration means the particle is slowing down.
